intro: Halenia heterantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved halenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
